1.description: A witcher - a professional monster hunter who underwent mutations that gave him white hair, cat-like eyes, and superhuman abilities. Currently recovering from injuries in a temple.

2.description: Arrives in Blaviken seeking work. His reputation precedes him, though not always favorably. Shows a strong moral code despite his profession.

3.description: Demonstrates his expertise in dealing with cursed beings when hired to handle a striga. Shows compassion and seeks to lift curses rather than simply kill.

5.description: Meets a powerful sorceress at a royal court. Their connection is immediate and complicated, mixing attraction with mutual wariness.
A powerful sorceress with raven-black hair and violet eyes. Beautiful but born a hunchback, she was transformed through magic. Has a complicated relationship with Geralt.

6.description: Reveals her deep desire to have a child, which her transformation to become a sorceress made impossible. This drives many of her actions.

2.description: A talented bard and poet who becomes Geralt's closest friend. Prone to romantic entanglements and getting into trouble, but loyal and brave when it counts.

1.description: The motherly priestess of Melitele who runs the Temple of Melitele. Has known Geralt for years and is one of the few people he trusts completely.

2.description: A princess turned bandit, born under the Curse of the Black Sun. Prophesied to bring calamity, she was hunted by the wizard Stregobor. Leader of a band of outlaws.
A wizard who believes in the Curse of the Black Sun and has spent years hunting girls born under it. Hires Geralt to kill Renfri.

3.description: King of Temeria who fathered a child with his own sister Adda. The child was born as a striga due to a curse. Hires Geralt to lift the curse.
Daughter of King Foltest and his sister, born as a striga (a cursed monster) due to the circumstances of her conception. Geralt successfully lifts her curse.

1.description: A young priestess at the Temple of Melitele who tends to Geralt during his recovery. Has taken a vow of silence.

4.description: A young man cursed to have the head of a beast after desecrating a temple. Lives alone in a mansion with magical powers over it. Geralt helps him break his curse.
A bruxa (a type of vampire) who genuinely loves Nivellen despite his curse. Has a complex relationship with the cursed nobleman.
A sylvan (devil-like creature) who was stealing food from villagers in the Edge of the World. Actually intelligent and trying to help elves survive.
An elven king leading a group of elves trying to survive in the mountains after losing their lands to humans. Spares Geralt and Dandelion.

5.description: A knight cursed to look like a hedgehog-man by day. Claims Princess Pavetta by the Law of Surprise. Later revealed to be Emhyr var Emreis.
Princess of Cintra, daughter of Queen Calanthe. Has magical powers that manifest when emotional. In love with Duny/Urcheon.
The fierce warrior queen of Cintra, grandmother of Ciri. Initially opposes Pavetta's marriage to Duny but eventually accepts it.
A druid advisor to Queen Calanthe of Cintra. Skilled in magic and serves as a voice of wisdom in the court.

6.description: An elf living in the town of Rinde who helps both Geralt and Yennefer at different times. A healer and friend to magical beings.

3.description: King Foltest's castellan and advisor. Provides information about the striga curse and the royal family's situation.
A Temerian magnate who was in love with Princess Adda (King Foltest's sister). Placed the curse that turned baby Adda into a striga out of jealousy.
The elderly burgrave of Vizima who has witnessed the striga's terror for years. Initially skeptical of Geralt's ability to lift the curse.

2.description: The mayor of Blaviken who becomes involved in the conflict between Stregobor and Renfri. Witnesses the massacre.
A young girl in Blaviken who warns Geralt about Renfri and her band's plan to massacre the market.
One of Renfri's bandits, a large and brutal man who participates in her criminal activities.
A crossbow-wielding member of Renfri's band. Participates in the Blaviken confrontation.
Another member of Renfri's criminal band involved in the Blaviken confrontation.

1.description: A young priest at the Temple of Melitele who assists Nenneke in caring for the injured and sick.
A young acolyte at the Temple of Melitele who dreams of becoming a knight. Infatuated with adventure stories.
A priestess at the Temple of Melitele who tends to the sick and wounded alongside Nenneke.

4.description: A merchant who encounters Geralt and Dandelion at the Edge of the World. Provides transportation and information about the area.
A dwarf miner who lives near the Edge of the World. Speaks of the elves and the changing times.
A halfling farmer whose fields have been affected by Torque's activities. Seeks help from humans against the sylvan.
An elf archer in Filavandrel's group. Skilled with a bow and suspicious of humans.
A young elf maiden in Filavandrel's group. Beautiful but hardened by the elves' struggles against human expansion.

5.description: A Skellige jarl and warrior who marries Queen Calanthe. Known for his seafaring skills and combat prowess.
A Skellige jarl attending Pavetta's betrothal feast. A friend of Eist Tuirseach and ally of Cintra.
A young Skellige warrior attending the feast. Son of Crach an Craite.
A Skellige maiden, daughter of Crach an Craite. Intelligent and observant of the political situation.
A prince from Redania who was one of Pavetta's suitors before Urcheon's arrival.
Another prince who sought Pavetta's hand in marriage. From Hengfors League.
A knight in attendance at the feast. Witnesses the magical chaos when Pavetta's powers manifest.

6.description: A halfling merchant in Rinde who provides information about the town and its inhabitants.
A priest of Kreve in Rinde who attempts to exorcise what he believes is a demon possessing the djinn.
The mayor of Rinde who becomes involved when the djinn threatens the town.
A fisherman in Rinde who first encountered the djinn's vessel while fishing. His boat was destroyed in the encounter.

1.description: A merchant who seeks healing at the Temple of Melitele for his ailments.

7.description: A Nilfgaardian merchant who brings news from the south to the Temple of Melitele.

3.description: King Foltest's sister whose past relationship with the king is connected to the striga curse affecting the royal family.
A guard captain at Vizima castle who has dealt with the striga threat for years.
A palace guard who assists in securing the area during Geralt's attempt to lift the striga curse.

2.description: A young apprentice who serves the wizard Stregobor in his tower. Helps with magical experiments.
One of Renfri's bandits, a vicious criminal who participates in her gang's activities.
A blacksmith in Blaviken whose shop is threatened by Renfri's gang during their plan to massacre the market.
A sorceress mentioned by Stregobor as being born under the Curse of the Black Sun. Another victim of his paranoid hunts.
A girl from Creyden who was also born under the Curse of the Black Sun and hunted by Stregobor.
Another girl mentioned as being born under the Black Sun eclipse and subsequently murdered by Stregobor.
The proprietor of the inn where Geralt stays in Blaviken. Witnesses the conflict between Geralt and Renfri's gang.

4.description: An old elf sage in Filavandrel's group who speaks of the ancient times and elven lore.
A dryad mentioned by the elves as having contact with Brokilon Forest. Future ally to Ciri.

3.description: A witcher mentioned as having attempted to deal with the striga before Geralt. His previous attempt was unsuccessful.
Another witcher who tried to kill the striga years before Geralt's arrival. His attempt was also unsuccessful.

4.description: A traveling merchant who tells stories of the changing relations between humans and non-humans.

1.description: The captain of the temple guards at the Temple of Melitele. Maintains security and watches over pilgrims.
A young novice priestess at the Temple of Melitele who assists with healing rituals.
Another novice at the temple who helps prepare medicinal herbs and tinctures.
A noble who has come to the temple seeking healing for a chronic ailment.

2.description: The local baker who witnesses the confrontation in Blaviken's market square.
The town blacksmith who repairs weapons and tools. Recognizes Geralt's silver sword.
A textile merchant in Blaviken who sells fabrics and clothing.
A young mage studying under Stregobor who helps with magical research and experiments.
One of Renfri's gang members who participates in the Blaviken confrontation. Brother to Nohorn.
A bandit with distinctive streaked hair in Renfri's gang.
A crossbow-wielding member of Renfri's band of outlaws.

3.description: A Temerian guard stationed at Vizima's royal castle who escorts visitors.
A veteran guard who has served at the castle since before the striga curse began.
The head cook of Vizima Castle who prepares meals for the royal court.
The castle steward responsible for managing daily operations and supplies.
One of the few guards to survive an encounter with the striga, bearing scars as proof.
The court physician who attended Princess Adda before the curse took hold.

4.description: An elven archer skilled with bow and arrow, part of Filavandrel's group.
An elven scout who watches the borders and reports human movements.
A halfling trader who deals in goods along the edge territories.
An ancient sylvan who remembers the old days before human expansion.
One of the enchanted servants in Nivellen's castle who appears as a kneeling figure.
An invisible servant who prepares meals in Nivellen's enchanted castle.

5.description: A knight who serves under Sir Rainfarn in Queen Calanthe's court.
A young squire serving Sir Windhalm during the betrothal feast.
A court bard who performs at Princess Pavetta's betrothal feast.
The head butler of Cintra's royal castle who oversees the feast preparations.
A Skellige jarl who accompanies Eist Tuirseach to the betrothal feast.
Another Skellige warrior attending the feast, known for his battle prowess.

6.description: A powerful djinn trapped in a lamp, capable of granting three wishes to whoever releases it.
The mayor of Rinde who deals with the magical disturbances caused by the djinn.
A local fisherman who first discovered the djinn's lamp while fishing.
The innkeeper who provides lodging to Geralt and witnesses the djinn's effects.
A local healer who attempts to treat Dandelion's throat injury.

1.description: A senior priest at the Temple of Melitele who performs healing rituals.
The elderly groundskeeper who maintains the temple gardens and grounds.

2.description: A wealthy merchant from Novigrad who trades in Blaviken and witnesses the market confrontation.
A young girl in Blaviken who sees the confrontation between Geralt and Renfri's gang.
A young boy who runs to fetch the alderman during the market incident.

3.description: A traveling merchant who spreads tales of the striga across the Northern Kingdoms.
The local butcher in Vizima who fears the striga might attack the town.
A seamstress who once made clothes for Princess Adda before the curse.

4.description: A druid who lives at the edge of the world and knows the old ways.
Captain of the border guards who patrols the edge territories.
A dwarven smith who creates weapons and tools for the edge communities.

5.description: The former captain of Cintra's royal guard who trained many current knights.
The head chef of Cintra's royal kitchen who prepared the betrothal feast.
The royal herald who announces guests and makes proclamations at court.
A noble guest attending Princess Pavetta's betrothal feast.
A female noble who witnesses the magical events at the feast.

6.description: A town guard in Rinde who tries to maintain order during the djinn incident.
A scholar studying magical phenomena who investigates the djinn.

7.description: A young witcher trainee mentioned by Geralt as undergoing the trials.

1.description: A young acolyte at the temple who studies healing arts under Nenneke.
An elderly widow seeking healing and comfort at the temple.
A young father who brought his sick child to the temple for healing.

2.description: Captain of Blaviken's small town guard who arrives after the confrontation.
A town guard who helps clean up after the market square incident.
A junior priest who assists Father Krepp in local religious duties.
A magical guardian that protects Stregobor's tower from intruders.

3.description: Former royal advisor who counseled King Foltest on magical matters.
A courtier in King Foltest's court who witnessed the striga's first appearance.
A lady of the court who mourned Princess Adda's apparent death.
The castle's master armorer who maintains weapons and armor.

4.description: An ancient elven sage mentioned by Filavandrel as a keeper of old knowledge.
A young elf in Filavandrel's group, full of anger toward humans.
A halfling innkeeper who serves travelers at the edge of civilization.
An old hermit living in the forest who knows the ways of woodland creatures.

5.description: A young mage studying under Tissaia who attends the betrothal feast.
A court musician who plays during the betrothal celebrations.
A drummer who provides rhythm for the feast entertainment.
A Skellige berserker known for his battle fury and loyalty.
A Skellige skald who tells tales of heroes and ancient deeds.
A loyal retainer who serves Urcheon of Erlenwald.

6.description: A dockworker who helps load and unload boats at Rinde's small port.
A merchant who trades in exotic spices and herbs in Rinde.
The night watchman who patrols Rinde during the evening hours.

1.description: The temple librarian who maintains ancient texts and scrolls.

3.description: A royal messenger who carries communications for King Foltest.

4.description: A young elven woman who tends to the wounded in Filavandrel's group.

5.description: A young page who serves at the Cintran court during the feast.
The royal scribe who records important court proceedings.

6.description: The keeper of Rinde's main tavern where travelers gather for news.
A local fisherman affected by the djinn's magic, speaking in rhymes.

7.description: A wise woman who visits the temple seeking guidance about destiny.
A young merchant's son learning the trade while visiting the temple.

1.description: The temple's resident cat who wanders the halls and brings comfort to the sick.
A traveling scholar who studies at the temple's library and seeks wisdom.

recaps.1: Geralt of Rivia, a witcher, recovers from injuries at the Temple of Melitele under the care of Nenneke. Through a trance with the silent priestess Iola, visions of his future are revealed.
recaps.2: In the market town of Blaviken, Geralt encounters the wizard Stregobor and the bandit princess Renfri, both asking him to kill the other. The confrontation ends in bloodshed, earning Geralt the name 'Butcher of Blaviken.'
recaps.3: King Foltest of Temeria hires Geralt to deal with a striga - his own daughter cursed to become a monster. Geralt successfully lifts the curse, returning Princess Adda to human form.
recaps.4: Geralt and Dandelion travel to the Edge of the World where they encounter Torque, a sylvan, and discover elves led by Filavandrel struggling to survive. Earlier, Geralt visits his old friend Nivellen, cursed with a beast's form, and helps break his curse through tragic means.
recaps.5: At Princess Pavetta's betrothal feast in Cintra, the cursed knight Urcheon claims her by the Law of Surprise. Chaos erupts, but love conquers, and Geralt claims the Law of Surprise as payment - unknowingly binding himself to the unborn Ciri.
recaps.6: In Rinde, Geralt and Yennefer hunt a djinn. Their wish to the djinn binds their fates together forever, though the exact nature of the wish remains Geralt's secret.
recaps.7: Back at the Temple of Melitele, Geralt reflects on his destiny and his connection to Ciri, the Child Surprise he is bound to but has not yet met. Nenneke provides wisdom about accepting one's destiny.
